item.description:
Since we get an extra hour of sleep on Halloween night, why not spend some of Sunday outside in the almost 60 degree weather?

If people think they'll still be sleeping off Halloween fun at 11am, let me know and I can push the time back a bit. Trying to capture the best of the sunlight hours we get these days.

Fall River - Freetown state forest is huge and gorgeous, its amazing that its part of Fall River, though it feels like worlds away. I'm thinking of doing a semi-short hike to the Ledge, a beautiful rock cropping over a lake. I haven't hiked in that part of the forest, though I'm estimating it to be only a few miles (total) from the trail maps. If its significantly shorter, I'll probably explore the other trails too. I might bring a light lunch/snack and sit by the lake for a bit if its nice enough, and anyone's welcome to do the same.

Just a chance to explore a new area, get out and meet people.

It is hunting season so I'd recommend any one who can to wear bright orange (ideal!) or yellow. If there's at least a few of us with reflective gear, we should be all set.

More information, trail maps, etc:
http://www.mass.gov/d...


Directions to the Bell-Rock Rd. Parking area (Super Easy to Get To!):

From 195 (Providence) - take Exit 5 for Rt. 79
Or, from Southern areas, take Rt. 24 North & you'll merge onto 79


Once on Rt 79 North / Rt. 24 North, take Exit 9 to continue on 79 North
Off the exit, go right onto Main St/79 North
Take your 2nd right onto High street and continue down High Street about 2 miles.

High Street becomes Bell Rock Rd. and there is a parking area not too far down on the Left hand side. I believe it is Parking Area "B" on the trail maps if anyone looks at them online.
item.name: Hiking - Fall River/Freetown State Forest
